nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.linear

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.BaseGeometry<Line>
      • nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.linear.Line
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GeometryConvertable<Line>, InfiniteGeometry<LineSegment>

    public class Line
extends BaseGeometry<Line>
implements InfiniteGeometry<LineSegment>
    Infinite line, represented by a point that it passes through and a direction.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Line(Vector origin, Vector unnormalizedDirection)
      Constructs a line that goes through a point, in a certain direction.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Line

        public Line(Vector origin,
            Vector unnormalizedDirection)
        Constructs a line that goes through a point, in a certain direction. Note that the direction need not be normalized.
        Parameters:
        origin - the line passes through this point
        unnormalizedDirection - the direction of the line

    • Method Detail

      • byThroughpoints

        public static Line byThroughpoints(Vector throughA,
                                   Vector throughB)
        Computes a line, by providing two points through which it passes. Note that the first provided point is used to define the line.
        Parameters:
        throughA - first point through which the line passes
        throughB - second point through which the line passes
        Returns:
        constructed line

      • bisector

        public static Line bisector(Vector pointA,
                            Vector pointB)
        Computes the bisector of two points. Note that the provided points are not used to define the line.
        Parameters:
        pointA - first point to define the bisector
        pointB - second point to define the bisector
        Returns:
        constructed line

      • perpendicularAt

        public static Line perpendicularAt(Vector location,
                                   Vector direction)
        Computes the line that is perpendicular to a given direction, at the specified location. Note that the location is used to define the line.
        Parameters:
        location - the line passes through this location
        direction - the direction, 90 degrees rotated from the desired line
        Returns:
        perpendicular line

      • clip

        public LineSegment clip(Rectangle rect)
        Description copied from interface: InfiniteGeometry
        Clips the infinite geometry to the part that lies strictly within the clipbox. Degeneracies (e.g. the parts coinciding with or touching the boundary), need not be returned. A null result indicates that the geometry has no part strictly within the clipbox.
        Specified by:
        clip in interface InfiniteGeometry<LineSegment>
        Returns:

      • perpendicular

        public Vector perpendicular()
        Returns the vector that is 90 degrees rotated (in counterclockwise direction) from the direction of this line. This perpendicular points towards the left side of the line.
        Returns:
        the perpendicular

      • isLeftOf

        public boolean isLeftOf(Vector point)
        Determines whether the provided point lies to the left of or on the line, at precision DoubleUtil.EPS.
        Parameters:
        point - test point
        Returns:
        whether the point is left of the line

      • isLeftOf

        public boolean isLeftOf(Vector point,
                        double prec)
        Determines whether the provided point lies to the left of or on the line, at a given precision. Note that a negative precision allows to test, "strictly left of the line".
        Parameters:
        point - test point
        prec - precision
        Returns:
        whether the point is left of the line

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        whether the point is right of the line
